Hi, I’m Javier! 👋 I’m a data science leader, open-source evangelist, and GenAI engineer who thrives at the intersection of machine learning, modeling, experimentation, and large-scale AI delivery. My North Star is simple: Solve real problems with data and share the playbook.

Data Science & MLOps

I first honed my data science skills by enhancing valuation and forecasting models with algos like ARIMA and XGBoost. After moving into health tech, I discovered a passion for building ultra-fast, enterprise-grade Shiny web apps.

Today, I spearhead machine learning and GenAI initiatives at Centene that enhance healthcare quality and customer experience for over 28 million members. I architect scalable ML solutions, empower junior team members to deliver value-driven software, document best practices, and publish packages and tutorials that reach 1,000+ data scientists, analysts, and engineers.

On any given day, you’ll catch me deep in Databricks, Positron (an OSS VS Code fork), RStudio IDE, JupyterHub, Posit Connect, and the Linux CLI wiring together Arrow, DuckDB, model-serving LLM endpoints, data pipelines, and Docker-ized services.

Languages

My daily languages include R, Python, SQL, and Bash, but my preferred language is R. I use R for a wide range of work including ML/AI model development, package creation, communication with data warehouses and REST APIs, vector DB + RAG solutions, automation pipelines, interactive apps, and websites (for example, this site was built with R + Quarto).

Data Science Communities

There are a plethora of online and in-person data science communities to learn from and share your own experiences. Online communities for open-source languages and data science are incredibly welcoming and below are my favorites:

  • SoCal R Users Group
  • Data Science Hangout
  • R-Ladies Global
